conversation.content: Ok lets review and update the project rules, i want to begin each conversation with a workflow to determine if this is "Task" "QA Finding" or "Discussion". All 3 of those will have there own set of rules. The Task and QA Finding workflows will use the Discussion workflow prior to beginning work on the task. A Discussion workflow will review all related files and tests. If its a Task you will ask if its a frontend or backend task, what the title is, what the description is, what component or service files are we working on. If none are provided use your best judgement. If its a QA Finding you will ask how to replicate the issue within the UI if its frontend or if backend ask for a sample of data we are passing to the backend api. If its a Task or QA finding you will update or create tests, prior to creating tests you MUST provide a list of ones you will update or suggested test cases.
Proposed comprehensive workflow classification system with Task/QA Finding/Discussion workflows, including Discussion-first approach, version classification, and test planning requirements.
Update the Task workflow to ask if this is a New Feature or Improvement of existing feature. Which would follow the MINOR patch versioning rule and QA Finding would follow the patch versioning rule.
Updated workflow rules to include New Feature/Improvement classification for MINOR versioning and QA Finding for PATCH versioning.
Update the discussion workflow to NEVER provide code changes unless the discussion is converted into a task or qa finding ONLY when i say "Convert to Task" or "Convert to QA Finding"
Updated Discussion workflow with strict restrictions - no code changes until explicit conversion to Task/QA Finding workflows.
